org.opendaylight.controller.forwardingrulesmanager

Interface PortGroupProvider


  • public interface PortGroupProvider
    PortGroupProvider interface provides all the necessary blueprint for a custom application to implement in order to provide Port Grouping Service. Custom Application that implements this interface will have to handle the opaque match criteria passed to it via PortGroupConfig.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean createPortGroupConfig(PortGroupConfig config)
      This method is invoked by the Controller towards the Provider when a new port group is configured.
      boolean deletePortGroupConfig(PortGroupConfig config)
      This method is invoked by the Controller towards the Provider when an existing port group is deleted.
      java.lang.String getApplicationDrivenMatchCriteriaUsage()
      Application returns an Usage string for the Match Criteria User Configuration.
      java.util.Map<Node,PortGroup> getPortGroupData(PortGroupConfig config)
      Returns the complete mapping database corresponds to a PortGroup Configuration.
      PortGroup getPortGroupData(PortGroupConfig config, long matrixSwitchId)
      Returns PortGroup data for a given Switch and user Configuration.
      java.lang.String getProviderName()
      Returns the name of the Custom Application that implements PortGroupProvider interface.
      boolean isMatchCriteriaSupported(java.lang.String matchCriteria)
      Controller uses this method to check with the Provider supports the matchCriteria String configured by the User.
      void registerPortGroupChange(PortGroupChangeListener listener)
      Registers a Listener for Port Group membership changes based on Custom application algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • createPortGroupConfig

        boolean createPortGroupConfig(PortGroupConfig config)
        This method is invoked by the Controller towards the Provider when a new port group is configured.
        Parameters:
        config - New PortGroupConfig object created by user Configuration.
        Returns:
        true if successful. false otherwise.

      • deletePortGroupConfig

        boolean deletePortGroupConfig(PortGroupConfig config)
        This method is invoked by the Controller towards the Provider when an existing port group is deleted.
        Parameters:
        config - Existing Port Group Configuration deleted by the user.
        Returns:
        true if successful. false otherwise.

      • getPortGroupData

        java.util.Map<Node,PortGroup> getPortGroupData(PortGroupConfig config)
        Returns the complete mapping database corresponds to a PortGroup Configuration. Its the PortGroupProvider Application's responsibility to manage the Switches & the Set of its Ports that correspond to each of the Configuration and return it to the Controller when requested.
        Parameters:
        config - User Configuration
        Returns:
        Database of Switch-Id to PortGroup mapping that corresponds to the Port Group User Configuration.
        See Also:
        PortGroupConfig

      • getPortGroupData

        PortGroup getPortGroupData(PortGroupConfig config,
                         long matrixSwitchId)
        Returns PortGroup data for a given Switch and user Configuration. Its the PortGroupProvider Application's responsibility to manage the Switches & the Set of its Ports that correspond to each of the Configuration and return it to the Controller when requested.
        Parameters:
        config - User Configuration
        matrixSwitchId - Switch Id that represents an openflow Switch
        Returns:
        PortGroup data for a given Openflow switch.
        See Also:
        PortGroupConfig, PortGroup

      • registerPortGroupChange

        void registerPortGroupChange(PortGroupChangeListener listener)
        Registers a Listener for Port Group membership changes based on Custom application algorithm.
        Parameters:
        listener - A Controller module that listens to events from the Custom Port Grouping Application.

      • getApplicationDrivenMatchCriteriaUsage

        java.lang.String getApplicationDrivenMatchCriteriaUsage()
        Application returns an Usage string for the Match Criteria User Configuration. Controller provides an opportunity for application to implement Custom Algorithm for Port Grouping. This method exposes the custom algorithm to the user so that the user can configure the matchString regular expression in PortGroupConfig appropriately.
        Returns:
        Usage string.

      • getProviderName

        java.lang.String getProviderName()
        Returns the name of the Custom Application that implements PortGroupProvider interface.
        Returns:
        Provider Name

      • isMatchCriteriaSupported

        boolean isMatchCriteriaSupported(java.lang.String matchCriteria)
        Controller uses this method to check with the Provider supports the matchCriteria String configured by the User.
        Parameters:
        matchCriteria -
        Returns:
        true if the Provider supports the matchCriteria String. false otherwise.
